meanings.definition: A star that suddenly increases greatly in brightness because of a catastrophic explosion that ejects most of its mass.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study supernovae to understand how stars explode.
meanings.sent2: The supernovae in the night sky were incredibly bright and beautiful.
meanings.sent3: When the supernovae went off, it was like a fireworks show in space.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter lit up the room like a supernovae in the dark sky.
meanings.sent5: The supernovae's explosion was so powerful, it could be seen from light-years away.

meanings.definition: The explosion of a star that increases its brightness to typically a billion times that of our sun.
meanings.sent1: Astronomers use telescopes to observe distant supernovae.
meanings.sent2: The supernovae's light outshone all the other stars in the galaxy.
meanings.sent3: The supernovae's blast was so bright, it made the other stars jealous.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a supernovae, lighting up the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: Witnessing a supernovae is a rare and awe-inspiring event in the universe.
